greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime factor of number of divisors of n.
comment: a(n) = 2 for nonsquare n. - _David A. Corneth_, Jul 24 2017
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
mathematica: a[n_] := FactorInteger[DivisorSigma[0, n]][[1, 1]]; Array[a, 90] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 01 2016 *)
program: (PARI) A071187(n) = if(1==n, n, my(f = factor(numdiv(n))); vecmin(f[, 1])); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 24 2017
(PARI) first(n) = my(v = vector(n, i, 2)); for(i=1,sqrtint(n), v[i^2] = numdiv(i^2)); v
xref: Differs from A329614 for the first time at n=324, where a(324) = 3, while A329614(324) = 5. A329613 gives the positions of differences.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 15 2002
ext: Data section extended up to term a(105) by _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 17 2019
